responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: PrivilegesHelper allows arbitrary command execution as root
    analysis: |
      The `PrivilegesHelper` component allows execution of arbitrary commands with root privileges. An attacker able to compromise an unprivileged process on the same machine can send a specially crafted message to the `PrivilegesHelper` XPC service, which will result in the attacker's command being executed with root privileges.
    cwe: CWE-78
    function_names: []
    filenames: []
    classification: very promising
  - headline: Time-of-check time-of-use (TOCTOU) in group membership check
    analysis: |
      The code checks for group membership of a given user, but the code's logic makes it vulnerable to a time-of-check time-of-use (TOCTOU) vulnerability. An attacker may be able to exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized access to the system.
    cwe: CWE-367
    function_names:
      - getGroupMembershipForUser:groupID:error
      - getGroupMembershipForUser:groupName:error
    filenames:
      - source/MTIdentity.h
    classification: slightly promising
  - headline: Unvalidated user-supplied format string
    analysis: |
      The code doesn't validate user input before passing it as a format string argument to a logging function. 
    cwe: CWE-134
    function_names: []
    filenames: []
    classification: slightly promising
  - headline: Denial of Service via Infinite Loop
    analysis: |
      The code does not appear to implement any measures to prevent or mitigate denial-of-service (DoS) conditions caused by infinite loops.
    cwe: CWE-835
    function_names: []
    filenames: []
    classification: not promising
```

leads.headline: PrivilegesHelper allows arbitrary command execution as root
leads.analysis: The PrivilegesHelper component allows execution of arbitrary commands with root privileges. An attacker able to compromise an unprivileged process on the same machine can send a specially crafted message to the PrivilegesHelper XPC service, which will result in the attacker's command being executed with root privileges.

leads.headline: Time-of-check time-of-use (TOCTOU) in group membership check
leads.analysis: The code checks for group membership of a given user, but the code's logic makes it vulnerable to a time-of-check time-of-use (TOCTOU) vulnerability. An attacker may be able to exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized access to the system.

leads.headline: Unvalidated user-supplied format string
leads.analysis: The code doesn't validate user input before passing it as a format string argument to a logging function.

leads.headline: Denial of Service via Infinite Loop
leads.analysis: The code does not appear to implement any measures to prevent or mitigate denial-of-service (DoS) conditions caused by infinite loops.
